newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan is bid $421 per tonne for basmati rice.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan is bid $421 per tonne for basmati rice.

text.p: The state-run Rice Export Corporation of Pakistan said on Sunday it had received two bids for the sale and export of 30,000 tonnes of basmati rice, the higher of which was $421 per tonne FOB.

An official said the corporation had made no decision on the bids for the rice from the 1995/96 (July-June) crop, but said they were well below the $433.75 per tonne FOB offered at last month's auction of 10,000 tonnes of basmati.
One exporter said prices had dropped in anticipation of the arrival of the 1996/97 crop next month.
The official named the high bidder as Hamid al-Faris of Saudi Arabia, but did not say how much the other contender, Arcom of Pakistan, had offered.
